document.docAuthor: Li, Jian Yong, Liu, Jie & Chen, Jian
document.masterDocTitle: A review of some Neriene spiders (Araneae, Linyphiidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of some Neriene spiders (Araneae, Linyphiidae) from China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neolinyphia japonica
Oi, 1960 : 224
, f. 322–324 (Dmf); Paik, 1965a: 67, f. 20–21 (f);
Ono, Matsuda & Saito, 2009 : 339
, f. 1215–1219 (mf).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Hubei :
Luotian County , Tiantangzai national forest Park , 30.41°N , 102.77°E ,
618m
,
20.vii. to 7.viii.2009
, X. Xu & H.J. Xie leg., 32MM and 137FF ( CBEE );
Hainan :
Bawangling Mountain National Nature Reserve , 19.13°N , 109.10°E ,
300m
,
21.x
,2009, H. Yu leg., 4MM and 6FF ( CBEE )
.

Diagnosis: This species is similar to
N. birmanica
in having a small paracymbium without broad and flattened distal arm, the simple embolic and the trapeziform atrium opening, but can be distinguished from the latter by the long and slender terminal apophysis with knob-shaped tip, the significantly long vulva (the length about 1.5 times width), the copulatory grooves with two and a half coils (with one and a half in
N. birmanica
) ( Figs 10–11 , 12 C–E, 33–34, 35C–E).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15.
Neriene cavaleriei (Schenkel, 1963)
, drawings based on specimens from Li Mu Mountain National Nature Reserve, Hainan. A, Pedipalp, prolateral. B, Suprategulum, retrolateral. C, Pedipalp retrolateral. D, Epigynum, ventral. E, Embolus, retrolateral. F, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. G–H, Epigynum, cleared. G, Ventral. H, Dorsal. Scale bars, 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 16.
Neriene cavaleriei (Schenkel, 1963)
, photos based on specimen from Li Mu Mountain National Nature Reserve, Hainan. A–C, Pedipalp. A, Prolateral. B, Retrolateral. C, Ventral. D, Embolus, retrolateral. E, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. F, Suprategulum, retrolateral. Scale bars, 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 17.
Neriene cavaleriei (Schenkel, 1963)
, photos based on specimens from Li Mu Mountain National Nature Reserve, Hainan. A, Female habitus, dorsal. B, Male habitus, dorsal. C–E, Epigynum. C, Ventral, on the body. D, Ventral, cleared, white arrow indicating the start of copulatory goove. E, Dorsal, cleared. Scale bars, A, B, 1 mm; C, D, E, 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 18.
Neriene clathrata (Sundevall, 1830)
, drawings based on specimens from Great Lake Eclogical Station, Liaoning. A, Pedipalp, prolateral. B, Suprategulum, retrolateral. C, Pedipalp, retrolateral. D, Epigynum, ventral. E, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. F, Embolus, retrolateral. G–H, Epigynum, cleared. G, Ventral. H, Dorsal. Scale bars, 0.2 mm.

Neriene clathrata (Sundevall, 1830)
, photos based on specimen from Great lake eclogical Station. A–C, Pedipalp. A, Prolateral. B, Ventral. C, Retrolateral. D, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. E, Embolus, retrolateral. F, Suprategulum, retrolateral. Scale bars, 0.2 mm.

, photos based on specimens from Great Lake Eclogical Station, Liaoning. A, Female habitus, dorsal. B, Male habitus, dorsal. C–E, Epigynum. C, Ventral, on the body. D, Ventral, cleared, white arrow indicating the start of copulatory goove. E, Dorsal, cleared. Scale bars, A, B, 1 mm; C, D, E, 0.2 mm.

E, Terminal apophysis, retrolateral. F, Embolus, retrolateral. G, Suprategulum, retrolateral. H–I, Epigynum, cleared. H, Ventral. I, Dorsal. Scale bars, 0.2 mm.

Neriene emphana

E, Dorsal, cleared, white arrow indicating the start of copulatory goove. Scale bars, A, B, 1 mm; C, D, E, 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: China ( Heilongjiang , Jilin , Shanxi , Beijing , Hebei , Henan , Hubei , Hunan , Anhui , Yunnan , Sichuan , Zhejiang , Fujian , Jiangxi , Shan-xi, Guizhou , Jiangsu , Hainan ); Russia , Japan , North Korea ( Fig. 69 ).
